column5: Thanks again guys.  The wind and rain kept me off the water today. I wanted so bad to get back out there. Found a sheltered bay,but the rain well,it was teaming down.  Old Ironmaker,I have had the chance to fish Erie. It was my very first Pro/Am. Drop shotting was the ticket for most,with the odd use of jerk baits. Great fishery.  I now have a new net and will get a scale for the next time.  Thanks for making my head swell more. LOL
awesome stuff Brian!  From a float tube no less!   All Im missing is the 200 hp to push it Ryan.LOL
Thanks again guys.  Thanks for making my head swell more. LOL that's why I posted that modified picture first...just to keep the swelling down.....lol
Atta boy Brian, beautiful fish.   Lew,it was like fishing at the back of your boat.

Very nice guys it seems you two always have a great time out on the water  Thanks Mike.  Think Terry and I have been fishing almost 10+ years now together. Every outing is a good for a laugh or two,somtimes 3,4,5,6 and so on.
NICE !!!!!! Love the tube setup .
NICE !!!!!! Love the tube setup .  Hey Ry  We need to get that tube on you know what lake.
I was so glad I got my YUM YUMMMY baits yesterday.   22 inches and mid 6,s  It was a fatty. Look at the yap on this thing.      it was a bit of a battle to get a grip on him. Need to get a net.LOL
Nice. Simcoe?
Wow wicked fish!!!! That must been fun in the yak, howah!
I still say 7lbs  it was a fun day float tube'n   here are a few  of the  many I caught
Oh thats a float tube? Lol, sorry i got sun glare on the phone. Even gnarlier yet!
Atta boy Brian, beautiful fish.
Wow, knew it had to be a big fish when an old guy claims PB.

I still say 7lbs  it was a fun day float tube'n   Ya,I love these before sunrise starts.  You kicked my butt again though. You went south,I went north. Go ahead and post some of those chunks bud. All quality fish.  Thanks fellas.
What a beast B, congrats!
Wow!!  Nice!!
Tanker  Congrats...
Wow, knew it had to be a big fish when an old guy claims PB.
LOL
Good looker for sure.Seen so many big ones today that wouldn't commit. Maybe one  lol.
A couple of short vids from this morning. Having fun.
Awesome fish Brian!!! Congrats!  Burt
Nice. Simcoe?   Sry Dan. Yes
Had a great year on Simcoe last year, have yet to make the trip this season. Amazing smallie fishery
Even more impressive landing it with no net in a float tube.  Nicely done.
So when do I get to come up? LOL  Amazing fish Brian!

That sir is one big sow. Being on Lake Erie and being spoiled with some of the craziest big smallies anywhere and I have seen some, actually many 6 pound fish, that is nowhere close to 6 sorry to say and I hate to break your bubble.  That fish is closer to 7 plus a few ounces. 7 minimum. She's a trophy fish in any lake, including Erie, in Ontario.  You were the Bassassin that day. I bow to you mi Lord.
Nice going bud.    Gotta get me some of those soon
awesome stuff Brian!  From a float tube no less!
Nice!!
Very nice guys it seems you two always have a great time out on the water
